units.title: iPSC dissociation and preparation for 10x microfluidic chip
units.text: TrypLExpress (Thermo Fisher) incubation for 5 min, followed by addition of mTeSR1. Cells were centrifuged for 5 min at 200g and resuspended in mTeSR1, filtered through a 20-μm strainer and washed with mTeSR1. Cells were then centrifuged again for 5 min at 200g and resuspended in mTeSR1, counted, diluted to the same concentration and mixed at equal ratios for the three cell lines to be loaded on the 10x microfluidic chip aiming for 10,000 cells.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, actionable protocol step describing cell dissociation, washing, counting, and preparation for single-cell sequencing.

units.title: Organoid dissociation for single-cell sequencing
units.text: Organoid pieces were incubated in Papain at 37 °C (enzyme mix 1) for an initial 15 min, followed by addition of Enzyme A (enzyme mix 2) to the Papain mix. Organoid pieces were then triturated using wide-bore 1,000-ml tips and incubated for additional intervals of 5–10 min with enzyme mix 1 (approximately 30 min.).
units.rationale: This describes a precise enzymatic dissociation protocol for organoids, including timing, reagents, and mechanical steps essential for reproducibility.

units.title: 10x Genomics droplet encapsulation and cDNA synthesis
units.text: In brief, cells were mixed with reverse transcription mix, gel beads and oil were loaded on the chip device to be coencapsulated into droplets, which underwent first strand cDNA synthesis thereby tagging mRNAs with a UMI and a unique cell barcode.
units.rationale: This is a core procedural step in single-cell RNA-seq library preparation, detailing the encapsulation and molecular tagging process.

units.title: Organoid fixation and cryoprotection
units.text: Organoids were washed in PBS before fixing in 4% PFA for 2–4 h. The excess of fixative was removed with three PBS washes and organoids were then transferred to a 30% sucrose solution for 24–48 h for cryoprotection.
units.rationale: This outlines a standardized tissue processing protocol for immunohistochemistry, including fixation and cryoprotection steps.

units.title: Organoid embedding and sectioning
units.text: Finally, organoids were transferred to plastic cryomolds (Tissue Tek) and embedded in OCT compound 4583 (Tissue Tek) for snap-freezing on dry ice.
units.rationale: This is a critical procedural step for preparing organoids for sectioning, specifying embedding medium and freezing method.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry staining protocol
units.text: Organoid sections were quickly washed in PBS to remove any residual OCT. Then, sections were incubated in antigen retrieval solution (HistoVT One, Nacalai Tesque) at 70 °C for 20 min, followed by incubation with DAPI (1:3000), Alexa Fluor 488-conjugated anti-rabbit antibody (goat, 1:1,000, Thermo Fisher, A11008), Alexa Fluor 546-conjugated anti-mouse antibody (goat, 1:500, Thermo Fisher, A-21123), Alexa Fluor 647-conjugated anti-rat antibody (goat, 1:500, Thermo Fisher, A-21247) and Alexa Fluor 488-conjugated anti-rabbit antibody (goat, 1:1,000, Thermo Fisher, A11008).
units.rationale: This is a comprehensive, step-by-step immunostaining protocol with specific reagents, concentrations, and incubation conditions.
